Key Match Events: Pakistan bowled New Zealand out for just 90 runs.
Shaheen Shah Afridi led the Pakistan attack with 3-13.
Abrar Ahmed and Shadab Khan took two wickets each.
New Zealand's highest score came from Mark Chapman with 19 runs.
Pakistan's Mohammed Rizwan scored an unbeaten 45 off 34 balls to anchor the chase.
Post-Match Reflections: Black Caps captain Michael Bracewell said the Rawalpindi pitch was not an easy one to handle.
Bracewell mentioned that the team was slow to adapt to the surface and put themselves under pressure.
Bracewell emphasized the importance of fighting until the end and reflecting on their performance before the next game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan has taken a 1-0 lead in the five-match series.
The series opener was abandoned due to rain.
